keys.answer_region_no: I haven't been to any of the regions mentioned above
keys.cookie_bar_text: With your consent, we will analyze your use of the CovApp for scientific research and to improve the CovApp for all users. If you consent to the transmission of analysis data, please click on “Accept”. You can use the CovApp without giving consent to analyze your use of the CovApp. For further information, please visit the
keys.cookie_bar_text_dnt: To offer you a better browsing experience, we use cookies. We respect your "Do not track" browser setting, analyzing is deactivated.
keys.data_privacy_content: CovApp – Data Protection Notice (Status: 20.3.2020) 1. Data Controller The CovApp is a joint project of Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin (responsible for the provision and hosting of the CovApp) and the nonprofit D4L data4life gGmbH. The organisation responsible for the processing of personal data is Charité - University Medicine Berlin Charitéplatz 1 10117 Berlin Germany Phone: +49 30 45050 Website: www.charite.de If you have any questions regarding the processing of your personal data, as well as your rights regarding data protection, please contact Phone: +49 30 450580-016 Email: datenschutz(at)charite.de 2. Which data is collected and how is it processed? The CovApp is used to ask questions about current symptoms, your last trips and possible contacts. These data are not attributed by name. The CovApp is a web application. The following data is automatically transferred to the Charité's web server, which is operated by D4L data4life gGmbH as a processor on behalf of the Charité, with a computer center in Frankfurt at the subcontractor Amazon Web Services (AWS): - IP address of the device used for the retrieval - Web address (URL) of the page from which the file was requested (referrer) - Date and time of the request - Data volume transferred - Description of the type of web browser used The above-mentioned data is not stored after the app has been used, so that no conclusion can be drawn as to the identity of the user. The answers to the questions answered in the app and the recommendations for action are stored exclusively locally on the terminal device you use (smartphone, tablet, or PC). This data will – if you wish – be summarized in a QR code. You can show this QR code when being tested for COVID-19, at a doctor's or hospital to facilitate the collection of the necessary anamnesis data. You can delete the data stored by CovApp on your terminal device at any time by clicking "Delete answers" at the end of the questionnaire. 3. For what purposes and on what legal basis are the data processed? The CovApp is intended to make it easier for users to assess for themselves whether there is a need for further clarification regarding a COVID-19 infection and offers concrete recommendations for action. The app thus serves to combat the current COVID-19 pandemic. The legal basis of the processing is Article 6.1. lit. d) and e), Art. 9. 2 c), h), i) of the General Data Protection Regulation in conjunction with § 14.1.3 of the Berlin Data Protection Act. In all other respects, the Charité's data protection declaration applies, available at https://www.charite.de/service/datenschutz/
keys.disclaimer_paragraph_1:
Dear users, The coronavirus pandemic is changing and in the future in Germany only people who have symptoms and meet the following criteria will be tested:
  • People who have had contact with infected individuals
  • People belonging to risk groups and those having pre-existing conditions that may intensify the severity of COVID-19 disease
  • People who could further spread the coronavirus
If you have used the app in the past, you will notice that the assessment is now different. We will continue to update our protocols in accordance with relevant authorities and institutional recommendations. For this, we are working closely with the Robert Koch Institute and the Federal Ministry of Health. The main message is: Please stay at home and do your part to help slow down the spread. Legal disclaimer Usage of this app does not substitute medical treatment by a physician or clinical diagnostics. The CovApp serves to improve the procedures at the Charité examination centre and other outpatient clinics in connection with the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2. If you currently feel seriously ill, please seek medical help.
keys.disclaimer_paragraph_2: This website uses cookies, which are necessary for the function of the website. Personal data is not stored and no conclusions regarding the identity of the user can be made.
keys.faq_content: About the coronavirus The scientific term for the novel coronavirus is „SARS-CoV-2“. This virus can cause a respiratory disease. The name of this disease is called „COVID-19“. Because the infectious disease COVID-19 has already spread across countries and continents, it's referred to as a pandemic. Transmission The new coronavirus is transmitted via droplet infection. It can directly be transferred between humans, when droplets containing the virus get into the respiratory system after they are absorbed via the lining of the mouth and nose or via the conjunctiva of the eye. But an indirect infection is also possible, when droplets are transmitted via the hands to the mucosa of mouth, nose and eyes. Symptoms occur 5 to 6, at most 14 days, after infection.  Symptoms After an infection with the coronavirus, the disease runs a mild course and is not life-threatening for most people. This extends to pregnant women and children. There can be flu-like symptoms, such as a dry cough, fatigue and fever. Furthermore, some patients suffer from a sore throat, headaches, limb pain and chills. Currently it’s been assumed that 4 in 5 cases run a mild course. Though in some patients the infection can have a serious course, causing respiratory distress and bilateral pneumonia. This mostly affects elderly persons or people with chronic diseases such as cardiovascular diseases, chronic lung disease, diabetes, high blood pressure, or cancer. Those severe cases have to be treated in intensive care in a hospital. Solidarity Although there is a very good healthcare system available in Germany, it is not prepared for a rapid increase in intensive care patients. But if it is possible to prolong an increase in severe cases, treatment of infected patients will continue to be available. This can only be done if every citizen practices social distancing. As a precautionary measure, especially for the elderly generation and the chronically ill, everyone should take the situation seriously and avoid social contact as much as possible. But please, provide for elderly and chronically ill relatives or neighbors and living alone or persons in need with food and daily life essentials. Be considerate and attentive for their needs and worries. Communicate with each other – but stay at least 1.5 meters apart. Act in solidarity. Protection To slow down the spreading of the virus, avoid direct contact, for example when meeting someone. Wash your hands regularly and thoroughly, at least 20 seconds with soap and water. Keep as much distance as possible when coughing or sneezing – turn away from other people. Sneeze into a sleeve or a tissue, which you throw into a bin immediately. Don’t share something you touched with your mouth, like a glass or a bottle, with someone else. Stay at home. Therapy The therapy of the infection depends on the severity of the disease. Mild cases don’t have to be treated and can get well at home. Severe pneumonia has to be treated, for example with oxygen treatment, fluid substitution or antibiotics to treat bacterial co-infections. This mostly has to be done in a hospital. Vaccination Researchers are currently working on developing a vaccine. Right now, there is no vaccination available which protects against the new coronavirus. Get help Violence against women support Hotline: 08000 116 016 Crisis Hotline: 0800 111 0 111 or 0800 111 0 222 Stay informed The German Ministry of Health regularly updates the information on the coronavirus. Charité researcher Prof. Dr. Christian Drosten keeps you up-to-date on the NDR podcast

keys.input_date_error_future: The date must not be in the future.
keys.input_date_help: Ensure to enter a full date in the DD MM YYYY format that isn’t in the future. For example, 09 03 2020
keys.legal_first_paragraph:
Legal notice

Disclaimer

General notice

The use of this app does not replace medical treatment. If you are currently feeling seriously ill, please seek medical treatment immediately. The digital application is not an application that provides diagnostic services. The application serves to simplify the procedures in care.

Liability for contents

As a service provider, we are responsible for our own contents according to § 7 (1) TMG (German Telemedia Act). According to §§ 8 to 10 TMG, we, as a service provider, are not obligated to monitor third party information transmitted or stored. Obligations to remove or block the use of information according to general laws remain unaffected.

Liability for links

Our offer contains links to external websites of third parties, on whose contents we have no influence. Therefore, we cannot assume any liability for these external contents. The respective provider or operator of the sites is always responsible for the contents of the linked sites.

Copyright

The contents and works created by the service provider on these pages are subject to German copyright law. The reproduction, editing, distribution and any kind of use outside the limits of copyright law require the written consent of the respective author or creator. Downloads and copies of these pages are only permitted for private, non-commercial use. Insofar as the operator did not create the content on this site, the copyrights of third parties are respected. In particular, content of third parties is marked as such. Nevertheless, should you become aware of a copyright infringement, please inform us accordingly. If we become aware of any infringements, we will remove such contents immediately.
keys.q_C0_comment:
Close contact with a confirmed case means:
  • Face-to-face contact for longer than 15 minutes
  • Direct, physical contact (touching, shaking hands, kissing)
  • Being within 1.5 meters of the person for more than 15 minutes
  • Contact with or exchange of body fluids
  • Living in the same apartment
Choose "no" if you have worn adequate protective measures (mask, smock) on contact.
keys.q_C0_text: Have you had close contact with a confirmed case?
keys.q_CZ_text: What day was the last contact?
keys.q_D0_text: Have you been diagnosed with chronic lung disease by a doctor?
keys.q_D1_text: Have you been diagnosed with diabetes by a doctor?
keys.q_D2_text: Have you been diagnosed with heart disease by a doctor?
keys.q_D3_text: Have you been diagnosed with adipositas (obesity) by a doctor?
keys.q_M1_comment: You take or get immunosuppresives after an organ transplant, in the therapy of an autoimmune disease, or during chemotherapy.
keys.q_M2_text: Have you been vaccinated against flu between October 2019 and today?
keys.q_P1_text: Are you 65 years old or older?
keys.q_P2_option1: Living together with family, in a shared flat, or in a supervised community facility
keys.q_P2_text: What is your current living situation?
keys.q_P3_comment: Care services or support that you provide in connection with your professional activity are not meant.
keys.q_P3_text: At least once a week, do you privately care for people with age-related conditions, chronic illnesses, or frailty?
keys.q_P4_option1: In a community facility (school, day care center, university, home etc.)
keys.q_P4_option2: No, in none of the above
keys.q_P4_text: Do you work in one of the following areas?
keys.q_S0_text: Have you had a fever (over 38°C) in the past 24 hours?
keys.q_S1_text: Have you had a fever (over 38°C) in the past 4 days?
keys.q_S2_text: What was the highest temperature, approx.?
keys.q_S3_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had chills?
keys.q_S4_text: In the past 24 hours, have you felt tired or worn out?
keys.q_S5_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had body aches?
keys.q_S6_comment:
The question relates to cold symptoms and excludes chronic cough, seasonal or allergy-related cough.
If you have a chronic cough, please compare your current coughing to your regular problems.
keys.q_S6_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a persistent cough?
keys.q_S7_comment: The question relates to cold symptoms and excludes chronic runny nose, seasonal or allergy-related runny nose. If you have chronic sniffling, please compare your current conditions with your existing problems.
keys.q_S7_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a runny nose?
keys.q_S8_comment: If you have a chronic bowel disease, please compare your current bowel symptoms to your bowel patterns under your existing medical condition.
keys.q_S8_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had diarrhea?
keys.q_S9_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a sore throat?
keys.q_SA_text: In the past 24 hours, have you had a headache?
keys.q_SB_comment:
Check the box if you:
  • Become breathless faster than usual or have difficulty breathing with light loads, such as a walk or climbing a short flight of stairs
  • Experience difficulty breathing or shortness of breath when sitting or lying down
  • Have a feeling of breathlessness/shortness of breath when getting up from bed or a chair
If you have chronic lung disease, compare your current breathing problems with your existing breathing problems.
keys.q_SB_text: In the past 24 hours, did you feel that you were more quickly out of breath than usual?
keys.q_SC_text: Have you had any taste and/or smell loss in the last 24 hours?
keys.q_SZ_text: With regard to all questions about symptoms: since when have you had the symptoms you specified?
keys.qr_code_paragraph:
Below, you find a summary of your answers as a table and as a QR code.

Please save the following QR code and the summary of your answers if you received the recommendation to present yourself at a testing site. If possible, print the summary and, if applicable, show it at the testing site.

If you need to leave home: Please keep a distance of at least 1.5 meters from other people, do not touch anything, and try to contain coughing and sneezing without affecting others.
keys.recommendation_case_1_additonal_info: Charité Virchow Wedding Mittelallee 1 Open daily 8 AM to 4 PM Evangelisches Krankenhaus Königin Elisabeth Herzberge (KEH) Herzbergstraße 79, 10365 Berlin Mon-Fri 10 AM to 7 PM, Sat/Sun 10 AM to 5 PM DRK Kliniken Berlin Westend Spandauer Damm 130, 14050 Berlin Mon-Fri 9 AM to 3 PM Coronavirus outpatient clinic Havelhöhe Community Hospital, building 16 Haus 16, Kladower Damm 221, Spandau Testing site: Mon-Fri 9 AM to 5 PM, Hotline: Mon-Fri 8 AM to 6 PM and Sat/Sun 9 AM to 3:30 PM
keys.recommendation_case_1_text: You had contact with a confirmed case and reported symptoms of the disease that could be explained by a coronavirus infection. Please contact your local health department or call a local public hotline to learn how to corona virus testing is organized in your area. You can find contact information for the regional health authorities on the Robert Koch Institute website For residents of Berlin: Please contact the hotline of the Senate Department of Health (Tel. 030 90282828) or make an appointment for the Charité's video consultation service. You can also visit one of the in-person testing sites. Please plan for long waiting times. According to the recommendations of the Robert Koch Institute, it would make sense for you to be tested. However, there is no entitlement to a test. The decision whether you should be tested is a medical one and may also depend on on-site test capacities.
keys.recommendation_case_2_headline: Please take care of yourself at home.
keys.recommendation_case_2_text: According to the current recommendations of the Robert Koch Institute, an examination for the coronavirus is currently not recommended for you since the contact with a confirmed case was more than 14 days ago or you had no contact with a confirmed case. The symptoms you mentioned may appear consistent with those of a coronavirus infection. It is best for you to stay at home, focus on your recovery and reduce direct personal contacts. If your symptoms become more severe in the next few days or if you are unsure what to do, please first contact your general practitioner or the medical on-call service (116117). Alternatively, you are welcome to make an appointment for the Charité's video consultation service or make an appointment using your mobile phone with KRY: https://kry.de. (KRY is a external provider. You will be redirected to a third-party website, for which the Charité has no responsibility). For residents of Berlin: You are welcome to make an appointment for the Charité's video consultation service or contact the Senate Department of Health hotline (Tel. 030 90282828).
keys.recommendation_case_3_headline: Stay at home and get healthy
keys.recommendation_case_3_text: You had contact with a person infected with the coronavirus within the past 14 days, but you currently have no symptoms. In your situation, a screening for the coronavirus is currently not recommended because a possible negative test result does not reliably rule out infection. Please stay at home. If you develop (cold/flu) symptoms in the next few days, you can use this tool again to check for new recommendations given your symptom profile and history. If you are unsure what to do or have any further questions, please contact your general practitioner or the medical on-call service (116117). You are welcome to make an appointment for the Charité's video consultation service or make an appointment using your mobile phone with KRY: https://kry.de. (KRY is a external provider. You will be redirected to a third-party website, for which the Charité has no responsibility). For residents of Berlin: You are welcome to make an appointment for the Charité's video consultation service or contact the Senate Department of Health hotline (Tel. 030 90282828).
keys.recommendation_case_4_headline: Please stay at home and follow the general hygiene recommendations.
keys.recommendation_case_4_text: According to the current recommendations of the Robert Koch Institute, an examination for the coronavirus is currently not recommended for you, since the contact with a confirmed case was more than 14 days ago or you had no contact with a confirmed case. Please stay at home, allow yourself to recover, and avoid unnecessary contacts with other people. If your symptoms get worse in the next few days or you feel unsure, please contact your general practitioner or the medical on-call service (116117). Alternatively, you are welcome to make an appointment for the Charité's video consultation service or make an appointment using your mobile phone with KRY: https://kry.de. (KRY is a external provider. You will be redirected to a third-party website, for which the Charité has no responsibility). For residents of Berlin: You are welcome to make an appointment for the Charité's video consultation service or contact the Senate Department of Health hotline (Tel. 030 90282828).
keys.recommendation_case_5_headline: Follow the general hygiene recommendations and practice social distancing
keys.recommendation_case_5_text:
Currently, you don't need to do anything, because:
  • You didn't have contact to a verified case
  • You don't have symptoms
To keep the risk of infection low, please pay more attention to good hand hygiene. Avoid unnecessary contacts with other people and stay at home if possible. When you leave the house, maintain a sufficient distance (at least 1.5 meters) from other people and follow the rules of conduct to protect against infection. If you develop (cold/flu) symptoms in the next few days, you can use this tool again to check for new recommendations given your symptom profile and history.
keys.risk_spreading_caring_for_relatives: Please discuss how to proceed with your general practitioner and try to maintain a safe physical distance from your relative(s) in care.
keys.risk_spreading_caring_for_relatives_head: You indicated that you take care of one or more relatives.
keys.risk_spreading_living_alone:
We advise you to call a trusted person on a daily basis to discuss your current condition and any potential worsening of symptoms.

Please inquire with neighbors, family members, and friends whether they are able to help you. If this isn't possible, you can contact volunteers in your area or do research on the Internet (e.g., using the "Corona Neighborhood Help" search term).
keys.risk_spreading_living_alone_headline: You reported that you live alone.
keys.risk_spreading_living_together:
Since an infection with the coronavirus cannot be ruled out, please stay in your room if possible as the virus is easily transmitted. In the event of contact you and your relatives should keep a distance of at least 1–2 m and wear mouth and nose protection. Do not use the kitchen, hallway, bathroom and other common areas more often than absolutely necessary and take your meals separate from one another in terms of time and space. If possible, people with risk factors should not be in the same household with you. These are:
  • people with suppressed immune systems
  • with chronic basic diseases
  • or the elderly
Further helpful information can be found as PDF (only in German) here or for your smartphone or tablet here.
keys.risk_spreading_living_together_headline: You reported that you do not live alone.
keys.risk_spreading_paragraphs: When you leave the house, keep enough distance (at least 1.5 meters) from other people and follow the rules of conduct for protection against infection. Please avoid unnecessary contact with other people and stay at home if possible.
keys.risk_spreading_workspace_medical: Please inform your employer of your contact or current symptoms and discuss further measures to protect the people around you and your colleagues.
keys.risk_spreading_workspace_medical_headlin: You are working in the medical field incl. nursing
keys.risk_very_ill_above_sixty_five: You reported shortness of breath. Please call your general practitioner or the medical on-call service (+49 116 117). If your shortness of breath becomes severe, please seek medical help. Please check in daily with a trusted person about your current condition and any potential worsening of symptoms.
keys.risk_very_ill_below_sixty_five: You reported shortness of breath. Please call your general practitioner or the medical on-call service (116117). If your shortness of breath becomes severe, please seek medical help.
keys.start_legal_paragraph: This application is not an application that provides diagnostic services. The application serves to simplify the procedures in care.
keys.start_paragraph_1_option_2: Decision support for doctor's visit or coronavirus test
keys.start_paragraph_2:
The CovApp is software developed by Charité in cooperation with Data4Life. You can use it to get recommendations for action in just a few minutes. The app asks you several questions including symptoms and potential contacts. Besides recommendations for action, relevant contacts, and structured results, the purpose of the app is to guide you safely through the various health care offers and, if necessary, to show you the way to hospitals or to examination centers. Please note that this app does not provide diagnostic services.

In this way, the CovApp can help you to better assess your medical condition, provide recommendations regarding doctor’s visits or coronavirus testing, and summarize relevant medical information for future doctor’s consultation.

How can I use the CovApp?

1. Start the survey by clicking "Start questionnaire"

The survey contains questions regarding your current symptoms and contact history. Completing the survey takes approximately 5 minutes. Please try to answer the questions as precisely as possible.

2. Survey and recommendations

At the end of the survey, the CovApp summarizes your answers and provides you with a recommendation for action, for example:

  • Advice to contact the public hotline for coronavirus
  • Advice to contact your general practitioner
  • Advice on social distancing

3. Preparation for doctor’s visit

When you're given the advice for a doctor’s visit or a visit to one of the coronavirus testing sites, please bring the QR code or print the summary presented. Some coronavirus testing sites (like the Charité) can scan the code so that your answers are made directly available to our medical staff and can be used for your consultation. This helps to speed up the process of the medical interview. If visiting your local physician or any other coronavirus testing site, please print the summary provided and bring it along to your consultation.
keys.start_paragraph_3: The survey is evaluated anonymously, and all information is processed on your device (for example, your smartphone). None of your answers will be forwarded to us, our server, or any third party.
keys.start_paragraph_4: The use of this app does not qualify as medical treatment. If you currently feel seriously ill, please seek medical help.
keys.start_sub_headline_3: Which data will be transmitted through the internet?
keys.start_sub_headline_4: If in doubt, call a doctor!
keys.summary_reset_headline: Do you want to do the test again?
